iti47:1.1: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
iti47:2.1: “Meditate wakeful, mendicants, mindful and aware, joyful and clear, and at times discern the skillful qualities in that state.
iti47:2.2: A mendicant who meditates in this way can expect one of two results:
iti47:2.3: enlightenment in the present life, or if there’s something left over, non-return.”
iti47:2.4: That is what the Buddha said.
iti47:3.4: the wakeful have nothing to fear.
iti47:4.1: Those who are wakeful, mindful and aware,
iti47:4.2: immersed in samādhi, joyful and clear,
iti47:4.3: rightly investigating the Dhamma in good time,
iti47:5.1: That’s why you should apply yourself to wakefulness.
iti47:5.2: A keen and alert mendicant, possessing absorption,
iti47:5.3: having cut the fetter of birth and old age,
iti47:5.4: would touch the highest awakening right here.”
iti47:6.1: This too was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
